data.title: Contact Undergraduate and Transfer Admissions
data.meta_description: Information to contact the Office of Admission at Western Carolina University
data.text:
Meet The Admissions Staff

Our dedicated admissions counselors are here to help you find all the answers to your questions about Western Carolina University and the college admission process. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact our office or contact an admissions counselor individually.

Our counselors are divided into two groups, trained to meet your personal admission needs: freshmen counselors or transfer counselors. Our talented admissions staff also handles International Student applications.

Not only do our transfer counselors work with students who have previously attended another college or university after graduating from high school but with students who do not have a recent high school profile.

Undergraduate Admissions Administrators

Undergraduate Admissions Counselors (Located on Cullowhee Campus)

Keyona Presha

Associate Director of Undergraduate Admissions Recruitment

kpresha@wcu.edu

828.227.2682

Hometown: Asheville, NC

Educational Background: Bachelor of Business Administration with a Concentration in Management, North Carolina Central University; Master of Science in Communication with a Specialization in Public Relations, Syracuse University

Professional background: I started my professional journey in banking in 2016 before transitioning over to admissions in 2019. I knew from my very first day in higher education that helping students in meeting their educational goals is my long term passion.

What I love about WCU: In addition to our location, the students, faculty and staff make you feel like you are a part of the WCU family the minute you step on campus.

Favorite Quote: “The higher purpose of my life is not the song and dance or the acclaim, but to rise up, to pull up others and leave the world and industry a better place.” – Viola Davis

Bobby Moore

Enrollment Counselor

rmoore@wcu.edu

828.227.2676

Serving students with a last name starting with N-R.

Hometown: Black Mountain, North Carolina

Educational Background: B.S. in Business Administration and Law, Western Carolina University

Professional Background: After I graduated from WCU in 2022, I applied for a different position within the university. To my surprise, I was invited to apply to the position of Enrollment Counselor in undergraduate admissions. What I really love about this position is not only do I get to work with people, but I get to work with incoming and future catamounts and help them achieve their goals of attending college! When you do something you love, it will never feel like work!

What I love about WCU: I am a proud third generation Catamount who made lifelong friends and memories here at WCU! I couldn’t imagine a better place to call home, get a great education and to begin my professional career with. I love the mountains, the campus, the outdoors, and the opportunities that WCU opened for me!

Favorite Quote: “Who speaks with frankness but always with sincerity and sympathy; whose deed follows his word; who thinks of the rights and feelings of others, rather than his own” – John Walter Wayland, 1899

Isaiah Lunsford

Assistant Director of Admissions

ilunsford@wcu.edu

828.227.2913

Serving students with a last name starting with D-H.

Hometown: Clyde, NC

Educational Background: Associates of Art, Haywood Community College; Bachelors of Science in Psychology, Western Carolina University; Masters of Education in Student Affairs, Western Carolina University

Professional Background: I began my journey in higher education by becoming a student ambassador for Haywood Community College. This would propel me at the end of my undergraduate career in 2020 to continue into WCU’s student affairs master program. This has allowed me to become a professional that can assist others in finding their own place of belonging in higher education.

What I love about WCU: The community works to support its members, no matter their identities or backgrounds, in a manner that is both personal and profound.

Favorite Quote: “So it goes.” – Slaughterhouse Five by Kurt Vonnegut

Jubilee Padilla

Assistant Director of Admissions

jpadilla@wcu.edu

828.227.3167

Serving students with a last name starting with A-C.

Hometown: Hickory, North Carolina

Educational Background: Bachelor of Science in History and a Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice, Western Carolina University; Master of Arts in History, Western Carolina University

Professional Background: I began to work regularly with students as a teaching assistant while working towards my graduate degree here at Western. Working as a teaching assistant is where I found my passion for working with students in higher education. From being a teaching assistant to working in admissions it has been my goal and pleasure to help students gain access to higher education and pursue their passions.

What I love about WCU: Western has always felt like home to me. It is a place that encourages community and growth in tandem. Western has allowed me to get close with my fellow peers and also build wonderful working relationships with faculty.

Favorite Quote: “Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead.” - Charles Bukowski

Kylie Cox

Assistant Director of Admissions

kcox@wcu.edu

828.227.3478

Serving students with a last name starting with I-M.

Hometown: Cullowhee, NC

Educational Background: BSBA in Sport Management and Business Administration & Law from Western Carolina University, Class of 2023

Professional background: 5 years in the Office of Undergraduate Admissions as a tour guide and office assistant

What I love about WCU: I love the campus community! The people at WCU care about each other and are always willing to help you out.

Favorite Quote: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." - Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

Madison Puckett

Enrollment Counselor

mpuckett@wcu.edu

828.227.3796

Serving students with a last name starting with S-Z.

Hometown: Erwin, NC

Educational Background: B.A. in English with a concentration in Professional Writing and a minor in Business Law, Western Carolina University

Professional Background: Back in my day as a student at WCU, I worked as a student worker in both The Office of Student Transitions and Advising Center. I found my interest in higher education there and pursued Admissions after graduating.

What I love about WCU: The institution’s passion for its student’s succession.

Favorite Quote: “It isn’t what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.” - Jane Austen

Undergraduate Admissions Counselors (Regionally Located)

Undergraduate Admissions Marketing & Visit Staff

WCU Entourage and Golden Ambassadors

The WCU Entourage and Golden Ambassadors are two elite groups of students that represent Western Carolina University and assist the Office of Admissions with student recruitment initiatives, related student activities include Open House events and tours of campus.
